14.6. A group Γ is said to have Property Pnai if, for any finite subset F of Γ \ {1}, there exists an element y0 ∈ Γ of infinite order such that, for each x ∈ F, the canonical epimorphism from the free product ⟨x⟩ ∗ ⟨y0⟩ onto the subgroup ⟨x, y0⟩ of Γ generated by x and y0 is an isomorphism. For n ∈ {2, 3, . . .}, does PSLn(Z) have Property Pnai? More generally, if Γ is a lattice in a connected real Lie group G which is simple and with centre reduced to {1}, does Γ have Property Pnai?
Answers are known to be “yes” if n = 2, and more generally if G has real rank 1 (M. Bekka, M. Cowling, P. de la Harpe, Publ. Math. IHES, 80 (1994), 117–134).
Comments of 2018: Property Pnai has been established for relatively hyperbolic groups (G. Arzhantseva, A. Minasyan, J. Funct. Anal., 243, no. 1 (2007), 345–351) and for groups acting on CAT(0) cube complexes with appropriate conditions (A. Kar, M. Sageev, Comment. Math. Helv., 91 (2016), 543–561). Some progress has been made in the preprint (T. Poznansky, http://arxiv.org/abs/0812.2486).
P. de la Harpe
